Remember, we read 2 Corinthians 4, in whom the God of this world hath blinded the minds of them that believe not, right? See, Paul, if you look at his ministry and you look at his example, as he stood before those that he had opportunity to minister to in the book of Acts, you find that often the apostle Paul shared his personal testimony. He remembers back to what we have as a record in Acts 9, when he was on the road to Damascus. And he remembers that he was lost, and he was blinded. And now we find that he enters into city after city, engaging person after person with the gospel, with this method of kindness and gentleness and a great measure of humility. Why? Because he remembers. He, too, was lost and blinded. Sometimes we can get frustrated. I'm guilty. There are times in which we get frustrated when we're trying to talk to someone and trying to share the gospel with them. But oh, how we need to be mindful of the fact that the God of this world, Satan himself, he's blinded the minds of them which believe not. Listen, there's all kinds of nonsense that's been pumped into the minds of people in our society today. I've often said that there was a day in our nation's history, not a day that I remember, but a day that I can read of in our nation's history where you could go to someone and you could confront them about their need for Christ, and you could tell them about Adam and Eve and the sin in the garden and understanding that sin, therefore, death has passed upon all men for that all have sin, Romans chapter number five, and you can share those things. And people had an idea, they had an awareness. of who Adam and Eve were, they had an understanding, a reference of Genesis 3, they might not have understood all of it, but they'd heard it and they'd understood a portion of it. Today you talk to the average person about Adam and Eve, you talk to the average person about the Garden of Eden, they have no idea what you're talking about, zero. In fact, humanism and Darwinism and all of those other things that are being pumped into the hearts and minds of our young people today, they're being told there wasn't even an Adam and Eve. They're being told there was no Garden of Eden. So we have a difficult job, but we have been given this opportunity. And I just wonder this morning, as we said our title, A Passion to Reach the Lost, I wonder as I would examine my own heart, as I would encourage you to examine your heart this morning, would you say that you have a passion to reach the lost? And I've often thought about this in my own life, and I'll ask you to think about this as well. Would you be accused of having a passion to reach the lost? It's one thing for us to say, yes, I have a passion to reach the lost, but would somebody else accuse you of it, which would be a good accusation, by the way, but would someone else say, you know, they have a passion to reach the lost? And would the evidence support the claim? Would the evidence support the claim? I have a passion to reach the lost. Does the evidence support it? And I ask myself those questions, and I ask that you would reflect, search your heart, that we would sing that song maybe in a new way than we've ever sung it before. Give me a passion for souls, dear Lord, a passion to reach the lost, understanding the truth, the reality, the certainty of eternity, the necessity of conversion, and the power of the gospel. I wish this morning, I've said this to people privately, I'm sure at some point over the last almost nine years I've said it publicly as well, sometimes I don't understand why people reject the gospel. It can be discouraging. You kind of say, do you understand what I'm offering you? Do you understand, not that I'm offering it, but that God would use us to be the channel, the conduit, the servant, the vessel that would deliver the message? So I'm okay, I don't need that. We just pray that our work, as Paul said in verse number two there, it was not in vain. It's not in vain. We just faithfully go. I wish everyone I ever shared the gospel with trusted Christ. Far too often, they've rejected the offer of salvation instead of receiving. But we must not allow that to cause us to be discouraged. We must not allow that to cause us to stop. We just continue on faithfully delivering the gospel, why? A passion to reach the lost. Father, we love you. We thank you for loving us. I thank you for those who went before us, who had a passion to reach the lost. We think of Paul and Silas and Timothy, as we've looked at this particular account and considered the ministry in Thessalonica. But no doubt in our own lives, this morning, we can think of those that we've encountered, maybe even the one that brought the gospel to our family. The one that you used, Lord, as a vessel to confront us with our need for Christ. That they had a passion to reach the lost. And God, I pray that you'd give us a passion, that we'd understand this thing of world missions and we'd understand that it's important that we support missionaries to go to various places of the world, to take the gospel to every tribe and every nation. And Lord, we thank you for the opportunity to engage in that work. God, would you help us to never forget that this right here is our mission field. Northern Virginia, Oakton, Fairfax, Vienna, Herndon, our mission field. God, help us to be faithful in our families, in our neighborhood, in our workplace, to have a passion to reach the lost. To have that understanding that each person that I encounter is going to spend forever in either heaven or the lake of fire. We're eternal beings. Lord, I pray that you'd give us a passion. If there's one that's been watching with us today, oh Father, I pray that you would speak to their hearts, draw them to yourself. We pray that the Holy Spirit of God would convict them of their sin, of Christ's righteousness, of judgment to come. That today would be the day of salvation. That they would stop putting it off. That they would gladly receive the gift of God, which is eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord. We pray, God, that you would work as only you can. Help us, Lord, to not only be stirred through this passage of scripture, but God, help us to be changed. We'll thank you for it in Christ's name we pray.
